issues.specificationExcerpt: headingSpaceAbove (H1) = 48pt (generous). Large space above signals new major section.
issues.observation: The H1 heading 'Heading Level 1' appears at the top of the document with a top margin that looks roughly consistent with the windowTopInset (32pt), but the space above H1 does not appear to include the full 48pt generous spacing on top of the window inset.
issues.deviation: Since H1 is the first element, the space above it is governed by windowTopInset (32pt) rather than headingSpaceAbove (48pt). This is acceptable for the first element. No actual deviation for interior H1 headings can be verified from this screenshot as there is only one H1.

issues.specificationExcerpt: headingSpaceAbove (H2) = 32pt (spacious). Proportional reduction from H1; still clearly a section break.
issues.observation: The space above H2 ('Heading Level 2') appears somewhat smaller than expected for 32pt. Visually it looks closer to 20-24pt compared to the body text line height.
issues.deviation: The space above H2 may be slightly less than the specified 32pt spacious spacing, though precise measurement from a screenshot is difficult.

issues.specificationExcerpt: headingSpaceAbove (H3) = 24pt (relaxed). Sub-section signal; less dramatic than H2.
issues.observation: The vertical gap above H3 ('Heading Level 3') appears visually similar to the gap above H4 and H5, rather than being distinctly larger.
issues.deviation: The heading space above H3 does not appear clearly differentiated from H4/H5 space above, suggesting the spacing hierarchy may not be fully realized for lower-level headings.

issues.specificationExcerpt: headingSpaceAbove (H2) = 32pt (spacious). Proportional reduction from H1; still clearly a section break.
issues.observation: Same as dark theme: the space above H2 appears somewhat compressed relative to the expected 32pt.
issues.deviation: The H2 space above may be slightly less than the specified 32pt, consistent with the dark theme observation. This is a cross-theme consistency point — both themes show the same potential compression.

issues.specificationExcerpt: headingSpaceAbove (H3) = 24pt (relaxed). Sub-section signal; less dramatic than H2.
issues.observation: The vertical gap above H3 appears visually similar to the gap above H4, H5, and H6 in the light theme as well.
issues.deviation: Heading spacing hierarchy below H2 does not appear clearly progressive. H3, H4, H5, H6 spaces above look roughly equal.

issues.specificationExcerpt: componentPadding = 12pt (cozy). Internal padding for code blocks, blockquotes.
issues.observation: The code block has visible internal padding. The top padding inside the code block appears adequate (roughly 12pt), but the language label 'swift' at the top of the code block sits at the very top edge, suggesting padding may be slightly tight at the top.
issues.deviation: The code block's top padding around the language label may be slightly less than the 12pt cozy specification, though this is difficult to measure precisely.

issues.specificationExcerpt: headingSpaceAbove (H1): 48pt (generous) — Large space above signals new major section
issues.observation: The space above H1 'Calibration Heading One' from the top of the content area appears to be approximately 32-36pt rather than the specified 48pt generous spacing.
issues.deviation: H1 top spacing appears roughly 25-33% less than the specified 48pt generous primitive. The space is closer to the spacious (32pt) primitive than the generous (48pt) primitive.

issues.specificationExcerpt: headingSpaceAbove (H1): 48pt (generous) — Large space above signals new major section
issues.observation: The space above H1 'Calibration Heading One' from the top of the content area appears to be approximately 32-36pt rather than the specified 48pt generous spacing.
issues.deviation: H1 top spacing appears roughly 25-33% less than the specified 48pt generous primitive. Matches the same issue observed in the dark theme, confirming this is a spacing constant issue rather than a theme-specific problem.

issues.specificationExcerpt: blockSpacing: 16pt (standard) — Consistent vertical rhythm between equal-weight elements
issues.observation: The spacing between consecutive body paragraphs ('This is the first measurement paragraph.' and 'This is the second measurement paragraph.') appears slightly tighter than expected, looking closer to 12pt than 16pt.
issues.deviation: Inter-paragraph spacing may be using the cozy (12pt) primitive instead of the standard (16pt) blockSpacing. This slightly compresses the vertical rhythm between equal-weight block elements.

issues.specificationExcerpt: Mermaid blocks display three possible states: 1. Loading: a spinner/progress indicator while the diagram renders 2. Success: the rendered diagram image displayed inline in the document 3. Error: a warning icon and error message if rendering fails
issues.observation: No Mermaid diagrams are rendered inline in the document. The areas below the Flowchart, Sequence Diagram, and Class Diagram headings are empty — no rendered diagram images, no loading spinners, and no error messages are visible.
issues.deviation: The PRD requires diagrams to display in one of three states (loading, success, error). Instead, none of these states are shown. The diagram content is entirely absent from the rendered output.

issues.specificationExcerpt: Mermaid blocks display three possible states: 1. Loading: a spinner/progress indicator while the diagram renders 2. Success: the rendered diagram image displayed inline in the document 3. Error: a warning icon and error message if rendering fails
issues.observation: No Mermaid diagrams are rendered inline in the document in the light theme either. The areas below the Flowchart, Sequence Diagram, and Class Diagram headings are empty — identical to the dark theme issue.
issues.deviation: Same as ISS-001 but in the solarized light theme. Diagrams are entirely absent, with no loading/success/error state displayed.

issues.specificationExcerpt: Five diagram types are supported: 1. Flowchart: directed graphs with nodes and edges 2. Sequence: interaction diagrams with participants and messages 3. State: state machine diagrams with states and transitions 4. Class: UML class diagrams with classes and relationships 5. ER (Entity-Relationship): database relationship diagrams
issues.observation: None of the expected diagram types (flowchart, sequence, class, state) are visually rendered. Only their section headings and descriptive text are shown.
issues.deviation: The PRD specifies five supported diagram types that should render as images. Zero diagram types are rendered in this capture.

issues.specificationExcerpt: Diagram containers use theme-appropriate colors: Container background: backgroundSecondary from the active theme
issues.observation: No diagram containers are visible at all, so the container background color cannot be evaluated. The absence of containers means theme integration for diagrams cannot be verified.
issues.deviation: Cannot verify theme-appropriate container colors because no diagram containers are rendered.

issues.specificationExcerpt: A language label is displayed above the code block when a language tag is present in the Markdown fence.
issues.observation: The language label 'swift' appears to be rendered inside the code block area at the top-left, displayed in a small monospaced font without distinct styling to separate it from the code content.
issues.deviation: The language label lacks visual distinction from the code content itself. While present, it could benefit from styling (e.g., subtle background pill, different opacity, or positioning outside the code area) to clearly separate it as a label rather than code content.

issues.specificationExcerpt: A language label is displayed above the code block when a language tag is present in the Markdown fence.
issues.observation: Same as dark theme: the 'swift' language label appears inside the code block without strong visual differentiation from code content.
issues.deviation: The language label styling is consistent between themes but lacks distinct visual treatment to clearly mark it as a label rather than code.

qualitativeFindings.observation: The overall dark theme rendering presents a cohesive, professional Solarized Dark appearance. The code block has a clearly distinct darker background, syntax highlighting uses recognizable Solarized color tokens (green for strings, blue for keywords, yellow for types), and the document has a comfortable reading feel with good contrast.
qualitativeFindings.assessment: The dark theme implementation meets the charter's standard of 'obsessive attention to sensory detail.' The color palette is consistent, the code block is visually distinct without being jarring, and the overall composition feels like a well-crafted native Mac application rather than a web page. This is ready for daily-driver use.

qualitativeFindings.observation: The light theme rendering presents a clean, warm Solarized Light appearance. The cream/beige background is correct for Solarized Light (base3). Code block background is distinctly lighter/different from the document background. Syntax highlighting colors are appropriate for the light variant.
qualitativeFindings.assessment: The light theme achieves a pleasant, readable appearance consistent with the Solarized Light palette. The warmth of the background avoids the harsh white of many light themes. The overall feel is polished and intentional. Daily-driver quality.

qualitativeFindings.observation: The heading hierarchy is visually clear: H1 is largest and most prominent, H2 is noticeably smaller, H3 smaller still, and so on down to H6. Each heading level is visually distinguishable from adjacent levels. The headings appear to bind to their following content (more space above than below), consistent with Gestalt proximity principles.
qualitativeFindings.assessment: The typographic hierarchy is well-executed and communicates document structure effectively. The size progression feels natural and proportional. This is a strength of the current rendering.

qualitativeFindings.observation: Inline formatting (bold, italic, inline code, links, strikethrough) is all clearly rendered and distinguishable. The inline code has a subtle distinct background. Links are colored in a visible accent color. Strikethrough text shows the line-through decoration clearly.
qualitativeFindings.assessment: Inline text formatting is comprehensive and well-differentiated. Each formatting type is immediately recognizable without ambiguity. This contributes to the polished, production-quality feel.

qualitativeFindings.observation: Cross-theme comparison shows consistent layout geometry between dark and light themes. Heading sizes, spacing patterns, code block dimensions, and margin widths appear identical across themes. Only colors change between themes.
qualitativeFindings.assessment: Excellent theme-independence of spatial layout. The rendering engine correctly separates geometry from theming, which is a sign of well-architected code. Both themes feel equally polished.

qualitativeFindings.observation: The document margins (left and right whitespace) appear generous and balanced, framing the content well. The content does not feel cramped or stretched. The reading measure (line length) appears appropriate for comfortable reading.
qualitativeFindings.assessment: The document framing meets the design intent of 'room to breathe.' Content width appears within the ~680pt target range, providing a comfortable 65-75 character line length for body text. The overall composition feels like a well-designed reading environment.

qualitativeFindings.observation: The overall composition in dark theme is clean, well-structured, and visually pleasant. Heading hierarchy is immediately apparent through size differentiation and spacing. The dark Solarized palette is correctly applied with warm-tinted text on a deep blue-green background.
qualitativeFindings.assessment: The rendering meets the charter's standard of 'obsessive attention to sensory detail.' The vertical rhythm is largely consistent, heading hierarchy is clear and well-proportioned, and the overall reading experience feels intentional and polished. This would be acceptable for daily-driver use.

qualitativeFindings.observation: The light theme rendering mirrors the dark theme's spatial layout precisely. The Solarized light palette uses a warm cream background with appropriate contrast for all text elements. Code block background is subtly distinct from the document background.
qualitativeFindings.assessment: Cross-theme consistency is excellent — spacing, layout, and element rendering are identical between dark and light themes as expected. The light palette feels cohesive and all colors belong to the Solarized family. The rendering quality matches the dark theme's polish level.

qualitativeFindings.observation: The code block has a visually distinct darker background with a 'swift' language label, rounded corners, and syntax highlighting. The blockquote below it has a subtle left border treatment. Both components feel well-integrated into the overall design.
qualitativeFindings.assessment: Component rendering shows good attention to detail. The code block and blockquote are clearly distinguishable from body text and from each other. The language label is a nice touch that adds utility without visual clutter. The overall component styling feels considered rather than default.

qualitativeFindings.observation: Heading spacing asymmetry is correctly implemented across all three heading levels. H1 has the most dramatic above/below ratio, H2 is proportionally reduced, and H3 has the tightest binding to its content. The Gestalt proximity principle is well-applied.
qualitativeFindings.assessment: The heading spacing hierarchy is one of the strongest aspects of the spatial design implementation. The asymmetric margins create clear visual binding between headings and their following content, making the document structure immediately scannable.

qualitativeFindings.observation: The HTML comment block at the top of the markdown file (containing fixture metadata like test characteristics and rendering expectations) is being rendered visibly as a styled code block within the preview. HTML comments should typically be hidden from rendered output.
qualitativeFindings.assessment: Rendering HTML comments as visible content creates visual clutter and breaks the reading experience. A polished markdown viewer should strip or hide HTML comments from the rendered preview, showing only the authored content. This detracts from the charter's goal of obsessive attention to sensory detail.

qualitativeFindings.observation: Same HTML comment visibility issue as in the dark theme — the fixture metadata comment block is rendered as a visible code block at the top of the light theme preview.
qualitativeFindings.assessment: Consistent across both themes, which suggests this is a systematic rendering behavior rather than a theme-specific issue. The visible comment degrades the reading experience equally in both themes.

qualitativeFindings.observation: The heading hierarchy and typography for 'Mermaid Diagram Gallery' (H1), 'Flowchart' (H2), 'Sequence Diagram' (H2), and 'Class Diagram' (H2) appear well-structured with appropriate size differentiation. Body text below each heading is clearly readable with good contrast against the dark background.
qualitativeFindings.assessment: Despite the absence of diagrams, the text elements that are present demonstrate good typographic hierarchy and theme coherence. The spacing between headings and body text follows reasonable vertical rhythm. The dark theme colors are consistent with Solarized Dark palette.

qualitativeFindings.observation: The light theme rendering of text elements (headings, body text, code block) uses appropriate Solarized Light colors with good contrast ratios. The code block background uses a warm cream/tan tone that is distinct from the page background.
qualitativeFindings.assessment: Theme coherence for text elements is well-implemented in the light theme. The warm Solarized Light palette is applied consistently across visible elements. However, the overall composition is severely undermined by the absence of the primary content — the Mermaid diagrams.

qualitativeFindings.observation: The vertical spacing between the Flowchart section and the Sequence Diagram section appears to have a large empty gap where a diagram should be rendered. Similarly between Sequence Diagram and Class Diagram. These gaps are conspicuously empty.
qualitativeFindings.assessment: The empty spaces where diagrams should appear create an awkward, incomplete layout that significantly detracts from the 'polished and intentional' composition standard. A daily-driver user encountering this document would immediately notice that content is missing, as the spacing suggests placeholders for absent visual elements.

qualitativeFindings.observation: The Solarized Dark theme is well-implemented. The document background is a consistent dark blue-gray (base03), text is rendered in light gray (base0), and the code block background is visibly distinct at a slightly lighter shade (base02). All colors appear to belong to the Solarized Dark palette.
qualitativeFindings.assessment: Excellent theme coherence. The dark theme creates a comfortable reading experience with appropriate contrast levels throughout. The code block distinction is clear but not jarring.

qualitativeFindings.observation: The Solarized Light theme is well-implemented. The document background is a warm off-white (base3), text is rendered in dark gray (base00), and code block backgrounds use a slightly darker cream tone (base2). All colors appear within the Solarized Light palette.
qualitativeFindings.assessment: Excellent theme coherence. The light theme maintains the warm, paper-like quality characteristic of Solarized Light. Contrast is comfortable for extended reading.

qualitativeFindings.observation: In the Keywords section code block, the 'import' keyword appears in a green color and 'Foundation' appears in a distinct color (likely the type color), demonstrating active syntax highlighting for Swift code. The color choices appear consistent with the Solarized palette's accent colors.
qualitativeFindings.assessment: Syntax highlighting is functioning correctly with visually distinct token colors. The keyword and type colors are clearly differentiated, meeting the requirement for multi-colored syntax tokens in Swift code blocks.

qualitativeFindings.observation: In the Keywords section code block, syntax highlighting is active with 'import' in green and 'Foundation' in a distinct color, mirroring the dark theme's token differentiation but using the Solarized Light accent palette.
qualitativeFindings.assessment: Syntax highlighting works consistently across both themes. Token colors are adapted appropriately for the light background while maintaining readability and visual distinction.

qualitativeFindings.observation: The overall composition shows consistent vertical rhythm between elements. The heading 'Syntax Token Reference' has appropriate visual weight and spacing. The transition from the metadata comment block to the heading to the Keywords section flows naturally. Code blocks have rounded corners and consistent padding.
qualitativeFindings.assessment: The rendering quality meets the charter's standard for polished, intentional design. The layout feels like a well-crafted document viewer rather than a hastily assembled web page. Spacing is rhythmic and content grouping follows Gestalt proximity principles.

qualitativeFindings.observation: Comparing the dark and light theme screenshots, the layout structure, spacing, element sizes, and content positioning appear identical. Only the color palette changes between themes.
qualitativeFindings.assessment: Excellent cross-theme consistency. The theme switch appears to be a pure color transformation with no layout side effects, which is exactly the expected behavior per FR-7.

qualitativeFindings.observation: The large HTML comment/metadata block at the top of the document is rendered as a visible code block taking up significant vertical space. This appears to be fixture metadata (describing expected rendering characteristics, token colors, etc.) that is part of the test document rather than a rendering issue.
qualitativeFindings.assessment: The metadata block is part of the test fixture content and is being rendered correctly as a code block. This is expected behavior for the theme-tokens fixture which intentionally documents color mappings for verification purposes.
